item.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that atrocities committed against the Rohingya by the Burmese military and security forces since August 2017 constitute crimes against humanity and genocide and calling on the Government of Burma to release Burmese journalists Wa Lone and Kyaw Soe Oo sentenced to seven years imprisonment after investigating attacks against civilians by the Burmese military and security forces, and for other purposes

latestAction.text: The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations. (text of measure as introduced: CR S7931-7932)

summary.text: Condemns the Burmese military's atrocities against Burma's minority Rohingya population, and calls on the Department of State to formally determine whether such acts amount to genocide. Commends the government of Bangladesh for receiving Rohingya refugees, and calls on Burma's government to immediately release journalists Wa Lone and Kyaw Soe Oo.

bill.title: A resolution condemning the mass atrocities committed against the Rohingya in Burma and urging accountability for the Burmese military.

item.title: A resolution condemning the mass atrocities committed against the Rohingya in Burma and urging accountability for the Burmese military.
A resolution condemning the mass atrocities committed against the Rohingya in Burma and urging accountability for the Burmese military.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations. (text of measure as introduced: CR S7931-7932)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
